title: Tom O'Halleran
deleted: According to [[On the Issues]], O'Halleran's 2016 campaign website said that he would "protect Social Security and Medicare from those who support dangerous schemes to privatize the programs, hand them over the Wall Street or turn them into 'vouchers.'" The 2016 Christian Coalition Vote Guide inferred that he would oppose repealing mandated health insurance.<ref>{{cite web |title=Tom O'Halleran on Health Care |url=https://www.ontheissues.org/House/Tom_O%60Halleran_Health_Care.htm |website=On the Issues |access-date=22 July 2020 |date=4 July 2017}}</ref>

title: Tom O'Halleran
added: In 2021, O'Halleran was among a group of Democrats who sought to remove a provision from a police reform bill that would end [[qualified immunity]] for police officers accused of misconduct.<ref>{{cite news |last1=Caygle |first1=Heather |last2=Ferris |first2=Sarah |title=Dems clash over Biden-era police bill after 'defund' attacks |url=https://www.politico.com/news/2021/02/24/democrats-defund-police-471201 |access-date=24 February 2021 |work=POLITICO |language=en}}</ref>
